snippet: Senior military officers were among the leading defendants in a case that highlights the power struggle between the pro-Islamic government and the military.
abstract: Turkey’s highest appeals court upholds convictions of 237 military officers accused of plotting to overthrow the government in early 2000s.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Istanbul, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Senior military officers were among the leading defendants in a case that highlights the power struggle between the pro-Islamic government and the military.

headline.main: Turkish Court Upholds Many Convictions in Coup Case
headline.print_headline: Turkey: Court Upholds Convictions of Military Officers

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
